intro: Zostera dubia, commonly known as the slender eelgrass, is a marine flowering plant found in coastal regions. It belongs to the family Zosteraceae and is characterized by its ribbon-like leaves that form dense underwater meadows. The plant typically grows in shallow, brackish or saltwater environments, often near the shore. Zostera dubia plays a vital role in stabilizing sediments and providing habitat for various marine organisms. Its reproductive structures are adapted for water dispersal, enhancing its ability to colonize new areas.
